p: Seasonality of MERS has been previously hypothesized from the high incidence of cases during spring and early summer months and it has been postulated that this may be correlated to the camel birthing pattern; young, newborn camels encountering MERS-CoV for the first time may get ill and transmit the virus to humans [ 13, 94, 95]. However, outbreaks in latter half of 2015 and early 2016 countered against the expected seasonality [ 96].
